titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Finkel Associates records, 1946-1987 and undated RL.11675
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-01-03 09:48:18 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Advertising executive based in Seattle, Washington; specialist in newspaper advice columns and cartoon advertisements. Collection includes clip art, cartoon and comic designs, advertising copy, print advertisements and other largely humorous printed materials that feature advertising characters, limericks, "do it yourself" hints and advice columns, and fact- and quiz-based promotional copy. Newspaper advertising services were primarily directed at local businesses including apparel and shoe stores, appliances and home furnishings, automotive dealerships and service firms; hardware stores, hotels and restaurants, insurance and real estate companies, sporting goods and travel agencies primarily in the Pacific Northwest and Canada. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Advertising executive based in Seattle, Washington; specialist in newspaper advice columns and cartoon advertisements.

Born 1918, Vancouver, Canada. 1936: Writer, Canadian Publishing Company. 1939: Advertising, Vancouver News-Herald. 1939-1941: Free-lance advertising copy writer; radio news program, CKMO; Sales representative, Malva Mfg. (food products). 1941-1945: Public relations and radio programming, Royal Canadian Air Force. 1946: Copy writer and account planning, Stewart-Lovick Ltd. advertising agency; Junior Chamber of Commerce, Vancouver. 1947: Advertising manager, Campbell Motors car dealership. 1948: Sales partner in an automobile dealership network. 1949: Moved to the United States; Promotion Manager, California Farmer magazine, San Francisco. 1952: Open Richard Finkel Advertising agency, Seattle. 1955-1962: Artcraft Features, a newspaper syndicate service. 1964: Territory Manager, Warner-Lambert Company (Richard Hudnut, Lactona product lines). 1970: Artcraft Features renamed Panorama Features as a joint enterprise between Richard Finkel & Associates, Richards & Roberts; and Lanson-Brooks agencies. Panorama eventually acquired by BBDO.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Richard Finkel Associates records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2005.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Richard Finkel Associates records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2005-0052

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
J. Walter Thompson Company. Bertram Metter papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Domestic Advertisements;

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Advertising executive based in Seattle, Washington; specialist in newspaper advice columns and cartoon advertisements. Collection includes clip art, cartoon and comic designs, advertising copy, print advertisements and other largely humorous printed materials that feature advertising characters, limericks, "do it yourself" hints and advice columns, and fact- and quiz-based promotional copy. Newspaper advertising services were primarily directed at local businesses including apparel and shoe stores, appliances and home furnishings, automotive dealerships and service firms; hardware stores, hotels and restaurants, insurance and real estate companies, sporting goods and travel agencies primarily in the Pacific Northwest and Canada. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
